result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dean Gary Buehler was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Probation feels appropriate at 1 year, 6 months, may petition Court for early discharge.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $1,744.00 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.
Subject to Work Release & Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must provide DNA sample.  No surcharge.
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Will hold open ability to use EM if Jail cannot meet needs or health deteriorates.  
If in treatment/medical facility, Court grants treatment/medical release.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean Gary Buehler

Defendant Dean Gary Buehler in court with attorney James H Krave.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:37 am.  
CT finds not elig for CIP.  CT finds elig for SA pgm.  w/h sentence, probation for up to 3 yrs.  If probation feels approp at 1 1/2 yrs may petition court for early discharge.  6 mo PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  No sentence credit.  Will hold open ability to use EM if jail cannot meet needs or health deteriorates.  $1744 fine/costs.  AODA & comply.  2 yr revocation w/ credit for pd of admin susp/revoc.  2 yr IID.  Must provide DNA sample.  No surcharge.  Must report to jail today by 6 pm.  If in treatment/medical, grant treatment/medical release.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
